the White House and Congress. On Dec. 10, Sen. Bernie Sanders , an independent, took the floor of the Senate and didn't relinquish it for 8 1/2 hours. His words are being assembled into a book entitled The Speech: A Historic Filibuster on Corporate Greed and the Decline of Our Middle Class. The book's publisher, Nation Books, says millions followed the speech online, crashing the Senate server. A print book is due out next month. An electronic book will be published Jan. 28. Rep. Mike Pence arrived at Columbus in his east-central Indiana district for a town hall meeting, the sort of event that usually attracted a few dozen constituents. Surprised to see the hallway outside the room crowded with people, their arms folded and brows furrowed, Mike Pence shouted down the hall to an aide, asking him to get a janitor to open the room. veteran who had served as CEO of Novell and chief technology officer of Sun Microsystems, Eric Schmidt was brought in to provide some`` adult supervision.'' On his Twitter account on Thursday, Eric Schmidt wrote: Day-to-day adult supervision is no longer needed. `` I believe Larry is ready'' to take over as CEO, Eric Schmidt said during a call with analysts.`` It's time for him to have a shot at running this.''
